website_summaries.verdict: Classic 1873 design featuring a button fly closure. Available in over 30 washes and colors. A popular everyday pair.
pros: Straight-leg opening, signature five-pocket styling, two-horse patch, and rivets
Popular among consumers for a mid-level rise, especially since the pair remains comfortable when sitting or squatting
cons: If you’re accustomed to zipper closures, the buttons take some getting used to in terms of fit and comfort

customer_reviews.title: Levis quality has suffered greatly
customer_reviews.text: For 30 years (about every 4 years) I buy 4 new 501 shrink-to-fit jeans. I will buy no other jeans... until now. I bought 2 new pair, washed them as I always have, and the button holes are shredding and catching the buttons and fraying and are already not closing. My 4 year old jeans seams are in better condition than the brand new pairs. OBVIOUSLY Levis has lowered themselves to the modern world of crappy construction. It's a sad day for me. I never thought they'd change--I thought Levis would be the one constant in an ever-changing world of companies lowering their standards and changing for the worse. But nothing is sacred. I will never buy Levis again.
customer_reviews.author: MacCabe

customer_reviews.title: Not the jeans you are used to.
customer_reviews.text: What a crying shame. These used to be my go-to jeans for darn near 30 years...I bought two pair, figured one had to fit. Did the magic in the bathtub, too big, tried hot water in the washing machine, they fit, then stretched out after a days wear. I returned one pair. I kept one pair. They are an awful light denim, the construction awful, just an all round shoddy imitation of a classic Levis Jean. Why on earth are they being made in Egypt? The pair I kept will be for yard work, painting etc. Don't waste your money...these are not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Staton R Winter

customer_reviews.title: Worst Levi's I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these I didn't believe the reviews. I mean what happened to my Levi's. I have Levi's literally 10 years old faded with holes but are still thicker than these. You can actually crinkle them in your hand and they stay crinkled up like a piece of paper they're no thicker than a piece of poster board or construction paper
customer_reviews.author: Osage Kid

customer_reviews.title: Made in India...low quality, questionable authenticity.
customer_reviews.text: Low quality "Made in India" junk - I question the authenticity of these Levis. First pair I bought are doing ok 6 months later. I then bought a 2nd pair and immediately felt like these were a much thinner denim. The 2nd pair had a small nick in the leg that I didn't think much of- just a thread. I put it in the wash to STF and it came out as a gaping hole that looked like it had been shot. These are not the rugged work jeans I grew up on the farm with. I question the authenticity of anything coming out of India - well known for low quality garbage and even lower quality QA/QC.
customer_reviews.author: BrettScout

customer_reviews.title: These look more like knock-offs than authentic 501’s
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair from kohl’s. Unfortunately, I bought them one size too small. With COVID, fitting rooms closed. Easy solution- buy one size up from Amazon. The pair I received looks like laughable knock-offs. They look and feel like polyester cotton blend- not 100% cotton. They fit like oversized clown pants. They have all the right tags and labels. Inside tag says made in Egypt. These are my personal opinions. I am not trying to persuade anyone one way or the other. I am simply sharing my experience. I am disappointed in Levi’s.
customer_reviews.author: alexis

customer_reviews.title: These are shrink to fit!
customer_reviews.text: I think alot of reviews on size, people just dont understand shrink to fit. I grew up wearing button fly 501s. I am small and wear 28x32 so I bought 30x34...washed them in hot water with softener and dried them on high heat....they are perfect. I live the colors. I got pastel green and pastel pink.
customer_reviews.author: Marion callahan

customer_reviews.title: 32Wx34L fit like I am used to and shrunk what I expected.  Happy.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. I usually buy a 32x34 and did so here. They shrunk just a little, but overall it was absolutely fine. I washed them warm and then let them air dry a few times before I started just washing them normally. Most of the shrinkage I notices was in the crossgrain (around), the grain (length) was almost no shrinkage (this I expected, just adding it to help if you guys want the input).
customer_reviews.author: Tchad ElliottTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Huge fit, didn't shrink enough.
customer_reviews.text: This I'd my second try at the STF process. Went up one size in the waist (38 up to 40) and 2 inches in inseam. I tried them on out of the package and they were so huge I wasn't confident they would shrink enough. Huge in hips and legs. I mean like baggy fit Jean's from the 90s. I put them in the tub with really really hot water. Let them sit for 30 minutes. Took them out to let them drip dry. Very minimal shrinkage. They fit like loose fit as apposed to baggy now. I'm returning them and ordering my regular size. I'll just line dry them. If anyone has any suggestions, please chime in.
customer_reviews.author: Vince C

customer_reviews.title: FAKE or Wrong picture
customer_reviews.text: These jeans have single stitch inseam along pant legs not (traditional) double stitch. They are either fake or the quality of the product has diminished significantly and the proper photo should be used to show the inferior current product. Quality of denim is also sub-par and less than what has traditionally been my experience (not as thick and does not shrink-to-fit with traditional ratios. Shame on Levi's or shame on Amazon or shame on both!
customer_reviews.author: Moderately Handy

customer_reviews.title: don't trust the sizing guide
customer_reviews.text: My son is very tall and skinny. It said to get 2 inches up in waist.... I'd recommend sizing up 4 inches. He is normally a 29 waist, so we got him the 32. Washed first time and now they are utterly useless and don't fit him at all. Way to small. Plus, now they are washed and I cannot return them. I don't know anyone else in the world that is 6'5 and approximately 27" waist. So I guess I will have to repurpose them as something else. I used to buy these for myself all the time and could bank on just getting about 2 inches bigger in the waste. But that isn't the case I guess..
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: Original Classic Levis 501 Jeans
customer_reviews.text: Original Classic levis 501 jeans. Very shiny and very well made, nice packaging. These are the same levis i used to by and they fit true to size. Im a waist size 33 but i ordered a 36 waist because i like to wear my jeans a little loose but i know when i give them a good soak they will shrink enough for my liking. I recomend sizing up as levis recomends on their label. Wash them if you want to or wait and wear them around while they still have a nice shine to them people know these are Levis and im proud to wear my Levis. Pairs good with .... Anything.
customer_reviews.author: JM :)

customer_reviews.title: Original Stiff Shrink to Fit
customer_reviews.text: These are nearly the original shrink to fit jeans. Not really sure where they were actually made, but the quality seems good. The cloth is a bit lighter than it used to be when I was a kid. Been wearing these jeans a long time and they shrink about the same as they always did. Shrink about an inch in the waist and two in the length on a 30x32. I use the jeans for heavy work. I am hard on them. They don’t quite hold up like they used to, but still a good value. The size they list will Not be the finished size. The size after washing will be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: His favorite
customer_reviews.text: 501 shrink to fit are the only jeans he has worn for 40 yrs. Tried other style Levis but they don't fit like 501 shrink to fit. Even 501 that aren't shrink to fit fit different.
customer_reviews.author: The Lake Lady

customer_reviews.title: The cut on these shrink to fit jeans is bad. I have other sanforized jeans that hold their ...
customer_reviews.text: The cut on these shrink to fit jeans is bad. I have other sanforized jeans that hold their original shape that fit far better right off the rack. I hot-soaked these three times to try to get a better fit but in the end they still don't. At $39.95 I could have bought four pair of rustlers. It's not in the material: It's in the initial cutting that the problem lies. They wont be going back because yes I've shrunk them but that's what should happen when it's faulty manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Good Deal Seeker

customer_reviews.title: They're not black.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with these black jeans is that they're not black. I didn't even take them out of the plastic. Maybe to get black you need to buy some other color like "inky black" or "blackety black" or "eyes closed in space black"? I guess calling them "stonewashed thrift store hand-me-down can't get a date in high school because you're a terrible dresser" probably wouldn't sell. Let's compromise and call them "dirty chalk board". And hey, if you don't have any pants at all, these are probably an improvement or if you're going to one of those 80's or 90's theme parties you'll get tons of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP, THIN DENIM -- No longer a fan of Levi's 501s.
customer_reviews.text: It was very disappointing to see that Levi's has abandoned quality and now makes a cheap product. So they have become a bottom-feeder, seeking to please the lowest common denominator of shopper. The 501 shrink-to-fit originals now have thin cloth. You can tell immediately that the gauge of cloth is thinner -- not like it used to be. Once you lose your reputation for quality, you don't get it back. Short-term thinking here. I no longer will shop for Levi's first. They were not fakes (I checked all of the telltale markers). Levi's = Losers.
customer_reviews.author: Non-Voter in California

customer_reviews.title: Purchasing Shrink-to-fit Levis jeans can be a little tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Theses jeans are of good quality but it was my 1st time experiencing "Shrink-to-Fit" jeans. I read some reviews that recommended you get 1 to 2 sizes bigger and I believe they were right on. I bought the jeans at my normal size, washed them as directed, put them on after I line dried them and realized right away I made a big mistake. I could not button them up at all. I will eventually purchase these jeans again at one of two sizes bigger then see how they fit after I wash them. If you want to take a chance buying these jeans, definitely buy them one of two sizes bigger.
customer_reviews.author: clarence jackson

customer_reviews.title: Fit great.
customer_reviews.text: I where 35 W 36 length. Very hard to find 35 waist jeans. 36 to baggy, 34 too tight. So I decided to test my luck with these shrink to fit. I ordered 36 W / 38 L washed them in hot water and put in the dryer and they fit perfectly. Moving forward I'll only wash and air dry but needed to put them in the dryer to shrink them down to my size. I look forward to years of use out of these jeans (as long as my waste doesn't get too big!).
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: These can't be the same quality as the old Levis. My husband has worn Levis jeans since I met him, my dad also but these are CHEAP not even the same quality. Purchased in April and already just 3 months have holes in the knees both sides. My husband is retired he wore these for 40 years at work NEVER wore the knees out but these new pairs knees are gone BIG HOLES. Very disgusted, huge waste of money..
customer_reviews.author: Jolyn Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Same as always
customer_reviews.text: A note -- these were ordered from the Levi store, not from any of the other vendors on Amazon. They are the same explicitly shrink to fit ones which I have been getting for 50 years, the sizing has not changed, and as usual, after washing they shrank the expected amount and were stiff as boards. I got them because they were on sale; the ones I ordered about 5 years ago are still good but will probably wear out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: John Lehman

customer_reviews.title: These are not your standard 501 shrink to fit jeans
customer_reviews.text: What a joke. These are gold glittery threw out the jean material. I can’t believe Levis’s would even put there name on these. What man would where shiny glittery jeans😡
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: The denim and dye are not like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Authentic 501's, fast service, shrink to fit in the same manner and the same sizing they have my whole life. Only 4 stars because of what Levi's has become, another greedy, offshore, sellout. Now as far away as Egypt ! The denim and dye are not like they used to be,I've been wearing them for sixty years.However, they are just as comfy as they have always been. Based on that alone, I'll keep wearing them 'til I die.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: No Longer USA
customer_reviews.text: Gave them a low rank due to the country of origin. Been wearing 501s since they stopped making bell bottoms in '79. In the 70's and early 80's Levi Strauss had a factory in Albuquerque, NM. They employed many of the West side's single Mom population giving families the income they needed to get by. Those women cared about the product they were making and it showed. Now the lines are off, the stitching is less than adequate but, I'm stuck in my ways. A shout out to the ladies of the Westside of Burque!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real deal treat ‘EM right
customer_reviews.text: Ok you have to experiment to get just the right size because they shrink like crazy: I got maybe an inch bigger in waist and 3” longer inseam, then washed in “sanitary” cycle ( long & hot) Do Not Put in dryer ( the dryer puts random “fade lines” on legs and messes up the fabrics good qualities. Pull them out of hot wash and spin and lay them flat or hang dry or better yet put them in famp( they will really conform to you then. But once you do a little trial and error, you will love these!
customer_reviews.author: Ma Thenen

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected, good value
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and concerned about fake knock-off production (still don't know) but these fit perfectly after one warm-water wash. I define perfectly as being within 0.5" in waist and length. I will only wash in cold water in the future to avoid possible further shrinkage. I am a light-usage consumer and have no need for frequent washing. I am not sure how they would wear under heavy (construction, mechanical) work conditions but I will buy next time when replacement is needed.
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: Beware vanity sizing
customer_reviews.text: I don't know when Levi starting vanity sizing these, but do yourself a favor and order at least one size down from what you actually want. On a hunch I ordered 2 sizes down in addition to what I wanted (I wanted a 38 pre-shrunk). The size 36 was actually a 38 and the size 38 was actually a 40. These were both made in Egypt. The tag is no longer leather but rather thick paper.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Good, (Besides major flaw) As always your results may vary.
customer_reviews.text: Following Manufacturers instructions for the shrink to fit worked just right, plus I take 'em out during drying ,shake 'em out couple times, press wrinkles out by hand when wet. They don't stay rigid and do lose all firmness and some color during first wash. So if you're after firm maybe bathe in 'em and air dry, roll up them long cuffs and roll on. Good luck. ***Unfortunately they came with a whole! and bad stitching on seam above rear pocket-not a minor flaw, hence the 3 stars.*** Hopefully exchange pair is same but better.😀 Keep in mind you can get U.S.made 501's.....for $295..00
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a sad day
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I did not read all the other reviews which correctly pointed out the low quality of these jeans. Like them, I assumed that Levi's 501's could mean only one thing: quality and durability. That is not the case, by any stretch of the imagination. The denim is lighter than before and the length is several inches short. I'll bought one pair as a test, and will never buy another. Time to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Going the way of the "T" REX.....
customer_reviews.text: I am a super active 67 years young...I have been wearing (and buying Levi's since I was 7 years old....OK....My Mom started me at 7 and she bought them)...The 501's shrink to fit material HAS BECOME THINNER AND THINNER as the recent years have gone by...This last set of 3 pair are the THINNEST materiel I have seen yet...Thus for the price totally ridiculous... Thank God the stitching hasn't gone SOUTH yet....I suppose quality stitching will be next.... Come on Levi get back to what you were RENOWN for and had going for you...Quality Material that gave us durability in the fields...Now it's becoming a joke....People are talking about this...Better listen, or you'll be going the way of "T" REX.....
customer_reviews.author: Yom Un Sun Manson

customer_reviews.title: Levi Knock offs ???
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 pair of Levi’s ...one pair received appears to be a Levi Knock off. The red pocket tag does not say “Levi” it only has the registered trademark symbol. No Levi tag on back waistline either. When washed they shrank horribly, that is what made us look at the jean a little more carefully to notice the lack of Levi symbols.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware Poor Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a few pairs of 501's and this cobalt/black pair I received felt paper thin and light as heck compared to my other 501's. Just feels like cheap materials not the Levi's quality I've grown up with. Definitely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: SC_Waffles

customer_reviews.title: This was a horrible purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these jeans in December 2019, and didn't try them on until late late January. They do not fit as described - these were a 30 inch waist and 30 inch inseam Leavi's 501 pair of pants (per the label) - once I tried them on I realized they were way to small, and measured them: 27 inch inseam and 28 inch waist! How do you screw that up?!?!?!?!?! Now I notice that I can't return them, as the Amazon site says the return window closed on 31 January, 2020 - less than 2 months from ordering??? I am not happy, in case that was not obvious..........
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: always buy in person
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had them for 10 days and the stitching on the backside is already starting to separate. I’ve come to expect sizing inconsistencies from levi’s but not the poor quality that these seem to have. Seller was Zappos so I don’t believe these are knock offs... but could be wrong. Lesson learned to always buy in person so that I can inspect all seams and the overall quality of jeans.
customer_reviews.author: KristinL

customer_reviews.title: Great fit after breaking in.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with 501's! I soaked my pair in in hot water and hung them to dry. I'd only sized up 1", so the waist and thighs were a bit snug at first, but both relaxed after a couple hours of walking around. The button fly was a bit stiff and difficult, but after a day it was nicely softened and easy to use, and I'll take a button fly over a zipper any day. It's been a couple weeks and they fit like a glove now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Advice in Q&A's was to buy 1 inch larger waist ...
customer_reviews.text: Advice in Q&A's was to buy 1 inch larger waist and two in length. I wear a 36 waist, but Levi's apparently does not make a 37 inch waist in the shrink-to-fit. Their Customer Service rep online told me that a 38 inch waist would shrink 2 inches. It didn't, not even after repeated washings in hot water and tumble dry low.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive item description
customer_reviews.text: Product misrepresented. Listed as “stiff” which means preshrunk 17oz heavy duty 501s. Received shrink to fit instead. Usually buy my 501s at a Tack store: where stiff means preshrunk heavy duty denim. Shrink to Fit jeans are also heavy duty but are labeled so. Very deceptive on part of seller as shrink to fit must be purchased larger to allow for greater shrinkage.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: A welcome opposite to stretchy clothes
customer_reviews.text: These remind me of my workbench. Hard, but in the way you want jeans to be. I really dislike all the stretch clothes invading stores. Even suits and jeans. This pair I’m not planning to wash or shrink. Just dry clean once in a while. They look good and the buttons seem tough and are easy to use. The complaints about cheapness make no sense to me. There’s nothing else like these on the market. I’ll get another pair in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome looking pair of jeans!
customer_reviews.text: I just love the way these jeans, look! I have never seen a pair of dungarees with a, "COLORED", camouflage print pattern design, I think they're very unique! This is still, the high quality, the high standard designed, denim jeans we're all familiar with, seeing, in Levi's! However, this particular jean is something that is fresh and fabulous, in my opinion! I just wore them today, actually and I looked, "DYNAMITE", I would recommend these jeans to "ANYONE", for purchasing! You won't be disappointed at all, trust me!
customer_reviews.author: Vannie Kerr Jr

customer_reviews.title: Where Levi's are made and their color seems to impact product fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought the exact same size of Levi's 501's earlier this year and these are smaller in the waist by about 1 inch (I measured). I haven't put them in the dryer but they were wicked tight right of the bag. The only difference I can see is that these were Made in Mexico and the original pair were Made in Egypt. Think it might be something to do with color? The original pair were basic Blue, these are Gray. Great color, just wish they fit the same! Guess I will have to try a large size if I purchase colored Levi's
customer_reviews.author: Julia N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice jeans, other than the size.
customer_reviews.text: Washed once, normal in cold, inside out. Hung dry. No way these pants are 32 length. I own several pair of 501’s. These 501’s fit like they are 2-3 sizes short in length and 1 size smaller in waist. Not sure what happened to them. Fit was a little small before washing. Now, they are unwearable. Washed them and tried to stretch them but that didn’t work. The pants feel just like they should. Nice jeans, other than the size.
customer_reviews.author: GRRRR

customer_reviews.title: Shallow pockets!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn 501 shrink-to-fit for like 40 years. I got confused with all overabundance of Levi products but finally found what seem most like the what I've always worn. BUT! The pockets are shallow! My phone barely fits into the pocket and is positioned right where I bend instead of on my thigh. My pen keeps getting pushed through the bottom of the pocket! I purchased my first pair of these in Sept 2018 and then just got another pair in the new year. Same deal: shallow pockets!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: As far as I can see, these are 501 jeans. They shrunk to the size I like to wear and I love the price. Here at the outlet mall they are about $28.00 more. Yes they are made in Mexico (since some have mentioned that), but I don't care. Again for me they feel and fit just like all the other Levis 501 I worn. I wear a 27×31, so I purchased a 28×34. I hope this helps 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: I question it’s authenticity.
customer_reviews.text: As a long time Levi consumer I was a little skeptical of this product. I even contacted Levi to try an authenticate it but they just suggested I only buy from authorized dealers. They were very shrink to fit except the length shrank a bit too much. I bought the same size 501’s that weren’t shrink to fit and they fit me much better. I won’t say these are copies but I’m not sold on their authenticity and I wish Amazon would police this better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Snodgrass

customer_reviews.title: Quality control non existant
customer_reviews.text: Bottom button in the fly way to low , hard to latch . Pockets in rear over an inch lower than any levis I own . One pair the fly is off to one side . On length one pair is longer . Both pair were to be 36x31 . I sent both back and requested 2 more in hopes somebody was paying attention when they made them . I ordered 1 pair 2 weeks before I ordered these and the fit and dimensions were correct .
customer_reviews.author: Bill Alden

customer_reviews.title: Old school stiff shrink to fit
customer_reviews.text: The denim is the thinner 11oz material. I really like the original 15oz unwashed, but it seems difficult to impossible to find. Trade off is they are cooler to wear but don't last as long. Still happy. Safety jeans... no getting anything accidentally caught in a button like you can a zipper...
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bergal

customer_reviews.title: There is no leopard print cuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these only for the leopard print cuff and it's just regular black jeans. They do fit well, but I'm disappointed. I wish there was a way to find out if they just mistakenly sent me the wrong ones. If they do have the leopard print cuff pants, I would return them. But I might as well keep them. Bummer. Also, they are on the thin side, which isn't a negative in my view. But if anyone is expecting "original 501s" like the listing said, they are thinner than the old style.
customer_reviews.author: Poobaunny

customer_reviews.title: Didn't shrink to fit properly
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought Levi's 501's from Amazon. The first time all 3 pairs shrunk and fit just right. This second time all 3 pairs were different. One pair was made of a different material than the other 2, and none of them shrunk to fit right. Not sure how that happens, but I won't be buying anymore Levi's from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Why the thin seams?
customer_reviews.text: Here is why I gave them four stars, I know it isn't the seller's fault but wanted to bring it to Levi's attention. I am NOT a fan of the thin seam at the bottom of each leg. They are now a 1/4" where in the past they were 1/2". I don't know why the change but it bugs me. What, if they were 1/2" you'd have to charge an extra five or 10 dollars a pair? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Classic Levi’s STF
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing STF 501s for well over 30 years. I normally wear 33 inch waist by 34 inch inseam jeans. With STF 501s, I buy 35 inch waist by 36 inch inseam. I turn them inside out and toss them in the washing machine in hot water. They then go into the dryer on high. They come out and they fit. After that, they get washed in cold water along with my other jeans. Your mileage may vary but this approach has worked for me over the course of three decades. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: DPT

customer_reviews.title: Faulty pair? I hope so.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to get these shrink-to-fits. I soaked them as ordered, let em dry, and slipped into the pair. That's when I noticed that the front left belt loop was literally hanging by a thread at the top. Approximately an hour later, I saw that the loop was hanging completely down. Pretty disappointing to buy a new pair of jeans and find them broken on the first wear. I've never had a problem like this before with Levi's, so I'm hoping it's just a faulty pair. I already soaked these, so returning them isn't an option, only learning how to sew. But I can add that to my quarantine to-do list, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: David Bush

customer_reviews.title: Buy with waste size 2 sizes larger if you plan to wash
customer_reviews.text: I learned that if you plan on washing your jeans (which most of us do) order them 2 sizes larger at the waist. They fit very snug as is before washing. After washing they will shrink quite a bit. Even the tag on them says to do so. I hope this saves some people from having to return their jeans.
customer_reviews.author: NBAcv

customer_reviews.title: Good old shrink to fit 501s.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying the same jeans in the same size for 35 years. The Fabric quality has sadly fallen along with the construction details. But they still fit exactly the same. And, if you look at the price compared to inflation they are a bargain. I think they were $30 in the late 80s which would be about $65 or so now.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you order the correct "shrink to fit" size- ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you order the correct "shrink to fit" size- not your regular pant size. These WILL shrink down when wet so you need to go through the proper break in and shrink procedure. There are tons of tips and tutorials on the Internet in how to size and do it right. Do your research first.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: Levi's jeans: the old reliable standby
customer_reviews.text: Levi's are ... Levi's. Probably the best denim pants available today, though I have to say they aren't the "old" Levi's that I could buy 25 years ago. Of course I'm not what I was 25 years ago either. These pants shipped very quickly and were exactly what I expected. I've washed them to shrink them, and they fit perfectly. If I needed more, I'd not hesitate to buy them again from the same Amazon source.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: another pair of 501s
customer_reviews.text: I will not know how they will fit until they are washed .they are shrink to fit and several months will pass before they fit right.They are just another pair of 501s. The news ones from the last 10 years don't fit as well as the ones from the past but what does.
customer_reviews.author: john westlake

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing 501s over 50 years. I still have some over 25 years old. These new ones are garbage. The fabric is cheap. Original double stitched seams are now single stitched. Pantleg hem is half size of the originals and doesn't set flat. These are NOT original Levi's. This was my last Levi's purchase. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Cook

customer_reviews.title: These are probably not real Levis.
customer_reviews.text: These pants are not even close to what I ordered. I don't think they are even real Levis. The fabric is thin and chintzy, the sizing was not even close to what it said on the label, and they didn't have the authentic Levis paper on them. Getting two new pairs sent to me, but I expect I'll be returning them as well since they will probably suck as much as these... Going to order directly from Levis from now on, or go down to their store and shop locally like I should be.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K. Tobey

customer_reviews.title: Fabric has defects - again
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair we've ordered that have had a line down the leg. The first pair had a fuzzy discolored line down one leg and the replacement pair has a longer line down the entire right leg. No point in ordering a 3rd pair - seems to be a manufacturing defect. Disappointed because Levi's used to be so reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Marmom

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: The denim is a good quality. They feel like they will hold up well. The STF 501s fit as I expected in the waist and length. They aren't loose and aren't tight. They have the authentic 501 fit. I used the washer and dryer to shrink them. The only thing I noticed different was the back pockets were a little smaller in width and length than my previous 501s. I had a little trouble getting my wallet in and out of the back right pocket. Other than that. They fit perfect and feel great wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as ever
customer_reviews.text: Lots of review here saying the quality has gone down on STF 501's. I've been wearing this model since the mid 70's and I would say the fabric on mine is slightly lighter weight than it used to be but still feels heavy, strong, and durable to me. I don't have any other issues with these. Some of the most negative reviews say their pants were made in Mexico or Haiti. Mine were made in Egypt. Maybe that is the difference. And, I was thrilled to find my hard to find size, 33x38 here. Can't find them in local stores anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DennisF6

customer_reviews.title: Lost me in their political support to take away my rights.
customer_reviews.text: Usual Levi's sizing and construction. However with the company's recent decisions to fund anti Second Amendment campaigns, I will no longer buy Levi's, Dockers or Denizen products. I will not sacrifice my Constitutional Rights to appease my comfort. I look forward to the day when companies return to business and away from social justice whining.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Already shank to fit someone else, not me!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sent me two pairs of already washed and probably worn “shrink to fit” 501 Levi’s. Once these are washed and worn ( your supposed to wear them wet out of the washer.... until they dry, So they shrink to fit you/me! These came in plastic sealed bags but there were no paper Levi tags on either of them and the leather Levi tag was wrinkled.... telling anyone they had been washed already! I’ll attach pics if I find out how
customer_reviews.author: D. dall

customer_reviews.title: Be careful in your selection.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I finally figured out what is wrong with the sizing from Amazon. Although Amazon lists all these 501 jeans as "shrink-to-fit", they're NOT. You have to select the color+STF ("rigid STF", "black STF", etc), or you get regular pre-sized jeans. I had thought the problem was with Levis, but it's with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing original 501s for nearly 60 years. Since I moved to Indiana I can no longer purchase these at retail stores. Like buying boots on line you have to know your size. Love them Very durable and last a good 2 years of hard abuse, if you don't snag them on something.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same material it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: The material is different and it is awful. I've been wearing the same pants for 30 years and this new stuff is almost unwearable. It looks different, it's stiff and comes out of the dryer so wrinkled you almost have to iron it. It isn't my imagination. I have a new pair of the same pants (same part number, etc) that still have the tags on them and when placed side by side with these new abominations it is obvious that they're different. Why Levi would change material is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: John Cowgill

customer_reviews.title: Three thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Shrink to fit is always a little nerve racking but this is my 3rd pair and I like them way more then regular Levi’s. I would normally wear 34x34 in normal Levi’s. The shrink to fit I buy 35x36 and just wash & dry them inside out all by them self. They are a little baggy which is what I like. Only thing is I really don’t like the button fly. But they seem to be much higher quality then normal Levi’s.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Same great crisp quality.
customer_reviews.text: Normally buy at Kohls and was weary of the quality but to my surprise they are the same crisp quality. Was having trouble locally finding my size but so convenient I was able to get them shipped in 2 days and less.
customer_reviews.author: emiranda64

customer_reviews.title: What A Shame
customer_reviews.text: I used to live in these jeans. I would never think of wearing anything but Levi's 501 stf. Somehow, Levi's has managed to completely destroy the one item that the entire company was built upon. The denim is flimsy. The new stitching is very feminine and cheap looking. I won't be buying Levi's ever again. For those of you who are new to the 501 stf, you're paying way too much for an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Denim is heavy, course and rough. Always buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Denim is heavy, course and rough. Always buy 33-32 yet this pair is too short and way too tight. An issue with Levi's and their inconsistency with quality and sizing. If you purchase, hang on to all the packaging and if it doesn't fit right then, pack it up and return it. These new jeans are being donated to a mens transition house and I sure hope some skinny, short guy can get some use from them. They certainly were not 33W, 32L. Will consider long and hard about purchasing Levi's in the future. Sizing issues with the 501, 511 and 505's. Try them before you pay for them! Wood 38
customer_reviews.author: Don 02703

customer_reviews.title: shrink to fit 501
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is they are not the blue denim I normally buy. Some things we are better off buying at a store, where you can see them before you buy them. They are still good jeans, just darker than I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Shrunk and Wrinkled Big Time
customer_reviews.text: IDK if these are factory seconds or new products but they shrunk big time and wrinkle unbelievable after first wash. Never has that happen to Levi’s 501 jeans before. I’ll be donating these and buying new pairs but from another source.
customer_reviews.author: James Barker

customer_reviews.title: Great jeans,  but don't shrink as much as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: In Gap jeans, I wear a 33x 32, which are a little short. I wanted jeans that would shrink to a 33. I ordered a 36x36 in these jean.s It pains me to write this, because it destroys the notion that I'm skinny, but after washing, the 36 waist shrunk down to probably a 35 and fits perfect. The length, did not. The website suggested ordering 3-4 inches longer for shrinkage. I think they only shrunk about 2. Still, I love these jeans. Those low-rise jeans that Gap puts out were giving me plumbers crack every time I bent over. Plumber crack no more.
customer_reviews.author: John Hext

customer_reviews.title: Not Pre-Shrunk
customer_reviews.text: I received these Levi 501 Jeans and was happy UNTIL I washed them and lost a couple inches from the bottom. They look like 'high-water' jeans now. The title in the store says 'Original Shrink-to-Fit' ... to me that meant they were pre-shrunk but I guess it meant the opposite. Either way it confused me and now I feel stuck with these ill-fitting jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Youens

customer_reviews.title: Not Preshrunk
customer_reviews.text: The jeans shrunk about two sizes after being washed. After examining the label I discovered that the jeans were only to be washed in cold water. I have not encountered jeans that were not preshrunk for many years and did not expect that they would have to be washed in any other way than in a normal hot wash. Since my jeans often get very dirty, I have no use for jeans that must be washed in cold water.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Buy in bulk every year
customer_reviews.text: My father loves these jeans and it makes it easy on me. I'm able to just buy 4-5 of the same exact color and get them and he has a nice few pairs that he wears down to the ground at work. Nice pants for nights out, special occasions. He has been wearing these for over 20 years and will not be changing anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Bradrp

customer_reviews.title: Answer to questions about shrinkage
customer_reviews.text: The photos shows 2 pair of shrink-to-fit 501's that are 38x34 (I normally wear 36x30 or 36x32). In both photos the bottom pair haven't been treated yet. For the top pair, I wore them in a tub of hot water for 30 minutes, let them line dry until damp, and then wore them until they were dry (did some housework and walked 2 miles). The length shrank ~3". The second photo shows the waist shrinkage, ~1" so far (both top buttons are aligned-notice the difference between the labels) and from past experience the waist will probably shrink another .5-1" over time. I don't plan on washing them again for about 6 months, probably longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cuicuic

customer_reviews.title: Made in Mexico or Egypt
customer_reviews.text: The 501’s I bought on Amazon were made in Mexico. The two pair I bought on Levi’s website were made in Egypt. The ones made in Egypt were softer, for better, and the color was more “blue” if you know what I mean. I have never heard of awesome Mexican cotton sheets, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Why did you change the denim?

I ordered another pair from another company hoping they would be the old denim, they weren't the quality is just so bad. I now have to search for a suitable replacement because I will not purchase this type of Levi 501 shrink to fit again. The denim is below the quality we are use to.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Good Blue Jeans.

Waist was perfect but inseam is is about a half inch too long after 2 washes.I will buy pre shrunk Levi’s jeans for now on better fit for me. Maybe more washing and drying the jeans will fit better over time.Just be very careful in sizing your shrink to fit jeans and follow the Levi’s chart.
customer_reviews.author: Dage Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wish had smaller available sizes
customer_reviews.text: Levi is a wonderful company but it’s very difficult to find smaller sizes for my brother. Actually close to impossible to find his true size. Sadly he only likes wearing Levi’s. Would be so much appreciated if they made smaller sizes to accommodate the smaller people.
customer_reviews.author: LadyReviews4fun

customer_reviews.title: Sorta like the originals, but not really
customer_reviews.text: Same complaint. I gor three pairs of the American made 501's and loved them. $88.00/pr notwithstanding. I think there are no more. I'm certain Levi Straus has a reason that those are discontinued, but I have yet to hear it. These are OK. Just OK. They wont last as long, they'll fade quickly, and they're much lighter denim. But this is the only way I can get 501's, so I'll grin and bear it
customer_reviews.author: arizona al

customer_reviews.title: Wrangler is 100 times better and built with quality jean materials
customer_reviews.text: The quality I was expecting from a Levi product wasn't there, Levi shrink to fit use to be high quality jean materials.Buttons were fit tight and snug into jean materials. customer_reviews.title: 501's that's all.
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great, I have about a 37 inch inseam. 6'5" 225. So these are great. Been wearing 501's for 37 years. The fabric of this pair is as good as they get these days. Not close to the 1970s/80s denim. I wish they would go back to the old school material.
customer_reviews.author: Bartley J Hallinan

customer_reviews.title: They are Shirk To Fit Levi's 501
customer_reviews.text: You should know what your getting if you order these. I have lots of shrink to fit so I know the size to order. If you've never worn shrink to fits go to Levi's web site and figure out what will fork for you. Before I even wear them I wash with soap in HOT water. They will bleed so wash them by themselves. customer_reviews.author: PJBPHD

customer_reviews.title: Are You Getting the Stiff Ones?!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you watch what you're purchasing, although all Levis 501's are good. Some, like I got, are the stiff ones...like back in the 1950's and old Farmer Dell movies. I mean, they're nice. They're just going to take a bunch of washings to soften them up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyLeePM

customer_reviews.title: Very good 501's.
customer_reviews.text: These STF 501's are made with quality. Following the buying instructions mine shrunk to the perfect sice for me though a bit longer in length than I expected. I would have given this 5 stars if it was made in the US, but these were made in Egypt.
customer_reviews.author: BBQ_POPE

customer_reviews.title: RIP Original Levi's 501's

I heard they had changed for the worse, but now I can see for myself. Extremely thin material, no double stitching on the legs, smaller pockets. For jeans these are pathetic...more like slacks than jeans. Really, really sad to have lost one of my favorite things. Unfortunately my very last pair of Levis.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Just Right Is The Correct Phrase
customer_reviews.text: Just Right Is, For Me, The Correct Phrase...For Levi's 501 Original Shrink-to-Fit Jeans. . I have been buying these since 1961 because they fit as expected all the time. Over the years I have had only one QC issue where I had to return them to the store for replacement. Thanks for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: cosmic gargoyleoil

customer_reviews.title: Orignal Shrink to STFV(shrink to fit) Levis
customer_reviews.text: These are the original STF Levis, add 1" in the waist, 2" in the length; Old School Method, do not wash. keep the color from fading, put on the jeans soak in warm to hot water (whatever you can stand) for 30 minutes, dry off with a towel and wear until dry, custom fit to you
customer_reviews.author: BigMike

customer_reviews.title: They'll be super stiff after that but the more you wear them
customer_reviews.text: These are shrink to fit, remember that! What I found out through some research is get the same size waist that you normally wear and plus 2-5" on the inseam based on if you want to cuff them or not. When you first get them, soak them in a tub with the water as hot as you can get it. Make sure they are inside out first. After an hour or so put them between two towels and step on them, hang to dry overnight. Let them dry first before wearing them or you'll get uneven stretching. They'll be super stiff after that but the more you wear them, the better they get. Way better than pre-shrunk normal jeans!
customer_reviews.author: AdamK1981

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!

customer_reviews.text: I opted for the machine wash method but that wasn't the reason for the poor review it was the massive blue dye and the nickle sized hole in one leg and not to mention and the garment tags sewn inside. they weren't like that back in the good old eighties they were proudly made in the USA
customer_reviews.author: MiKE

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite All Around Jeans
customer_reviews.text: The shrink to fit version is the heavy weight denim. Jeans are manufactured in either Mexico or Haiti. Either way the quality meets expectations considering that Levi's has outsourced all of their manufacturing to other countries. I'm a "tweener" in size so ordering my normal comfortable size yielded a washed and dried pair of jeans that fit just perfect. Length is good and waist is spot on. customer_reviews.title: 35 is bigger than 36......

customer_reviews.title: Good jeans that needs a bit of effort.
customer_reviews.text: The Levi's Shrink to Fit jeans are known for their slightly rough and stiff texture. These jeans require a different approach than most people are used to before you wear them. I would suggest reading the blog post below that describes a good way to break in the jeans: [...] A couple of notes: - The length will shrink when they get wet/washed, so order them long. - The waist will not shrink as much as mentioned so order them in your size or maybe 1 size bigger. - The colors WILL run, so wash/soak separately the first couple of times. Enjoy the starchy, cardboard goodness that the 501s offer.

product_meta.title: Levi's Men's 501 Original Shrink-to-fit Jeans
product_meta.description:
Keep it dark and clean by washing as little as possible, or repeat washings to fade them to your liking.



More than 140 years after inventing the blue jean, one thing is clear: Levi’s clothes are loved by the people who wear them - from presidents to movie stars, farmers to fashion icons, entrepreneurs to the everyman. 'Live in Levi’s’ asserts with confidence and pride that Levi’s clothes are indeed for everybody who’s not just anybody.
